pageContext.claim: “We can reduce the price of prescription drugs and ensure that terminally ill patients have a right to try. So important — right to try.  You know, those drugs, they sit in there for 12, 13, 14 years.  And a person is terminally ill, they have two months left, and under the old system they don’t want to give them even an experimental medicine because they’re afraid they’re going to be hurt.”
pageContext.analysis: The Food and Drug Administration and the Government Accountability Office both say that the FDA has approved 99 percent of requests for access to unapproved drugs.
